intro: Monnina cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its delicate blue-violet flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
